intro: Euphrasia purpurea f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered purple eye. This plant is a flowering species native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically white or pale pink, with prominent yellow spots on the petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or rocky habitats.
